title: TeXmaker+Miktex_PORTABLE+all_packages_WinXP-V-7-8-x32-x64.zip
description:
TeXMaker LaTeX editor portable WinXP, Vista, 7, 8, 10 x32, x64

With all packages, MikTex, and TexMaker portable.

Since it is nearly impossible to find a working portable version
of a pre-configured LaTex editor that includes all packages that
you need, here you have it. Compatible and tested on all common 
versions of Windows (XP, Vista, 7, 8, on both 32 bit and 64 bit)

================================================================

This ZIP file contains:


 â€¢ A huge number of TeX-packages.
   
   NOTE: The packages install automatically from local folder if 
   needed - i.e. if they were never used before with the Texmaker 
   after you start PDFlatex (F6). No repos required!

 â€¢ MiKTeX

 â€¢ Texmaker

 â€¢ PDFXChange Viewer (portable). Start with F7 after PDFlatex.
   This will not affect your local PDF installation.

 â€¢ A table editor and some manuals (in the "TeX_info folder).


================================================================

#How to install:

 â€¢ Extract the Zip-File to a folder of your choice (e.g. C:tex).
	
 â€¢ Navigate to C:textexmakertexmaker.exe	
								
 â€¢ run "start_TeXMaker"


#Making it work ("Log file not found" error):

 â€¢ copy the contents of HELLO_WORLD.txt

 â€¢ create a new file in texmaker

 â€¢ paste the contents of HELLO_WORLD.txt into the new file

 â€¢ save the file with name and location of your choice

 â€¢ open "Options" menu in Texmaker -> "Configure Texmaker
   Specify your paths for LaTeX, PDFLaTeX, PDFXChange 
   The files are located at

   [Parent folder (e.g. C:/tex)]/miktex/miktex/bin/latex.exe

   [Parent folder (e.g. C:/tex)]/miktex/miktex/bin/pdflatex.exe

   [Parent folder (e.g. C:/tex)]/PDFX/PDFXCview.exe
   (bottom right in the settings: "External viewer")

   NOTE: The program will complete the command line arguments
   for you.

 â€¢ save the file again
        
 â€¢ press F6 on keyboard (creates a PDF document of the current
   tex file)

 â€¢ press F7 on keyboard (opens PDF Exchange viewer)
		
It should display a neatly formatted PDF in the portable viewer.

Of course you can use your own PDF software to view the generated
files, but I'd recommend to stick with PDFX, because it is pretty
lightweight, non-Adobe, and your document hisory won't be spammed
over with a number of experiments you might try out with Texmaker.


Enjoy,
thc_phreak
